error.regex: cuDNN error: CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED|cuDNN (version mismatch|not initialized|failed to initialize)

verdict.summary: cuDNN library fails to initialize, typically due to a version mismatch between the installed cuDNN, CUDA toolkit, and the deep learning framework. Can also occur when cuDNN shared libraries are missing or LD_LIBRARY_PATH is misconfigured.

dead_ends.action: Set torch.backends.cudnn.enabled = False to bypass cuDNN entirely
dead_ends.why_fails: Disables hardware-accelerated convolution and RNN operations, causing 2-10x slowdown; treats the symptom rather than fixing the version mismatch

dead_ends.action: Download and install cuDNN from the NVIDIA website without checking CUDA version compatibility
dead_ends.why_fails: cuDNN 8.x requires specific CUDA minor versions; installing cuDNN 8.9 with CUDA 12.0 may fail because cuDNN 8.9 requires CUDA 12.2+

dead_ends.action: Upgrade only the CUDA toolkit without updating cuDNN or the framework
dead_ends.why_fails: Upgrading CUDA without matching cuDNN and PyTorch versions creates a three-way version incompatibility that is harder to debug

workarounds.action: Install PyTorch from the official channel with the correct CUDA version, which bundles a compatible cuDNN
workarounds.how:
pip install torch torchvision torchaudio --index-url https://download.pytorch.org/whl/cu121
# This bundles cuDNN matching CUDA 12.1; verify with: python -c "import torch; print(torch.backends.cudnn.version())"

workarounds.action: Use NVIDIA's official CUDA container images that have pre-matched CUDA, cuDNN, and NCCL versions
workarounds.how:
docker run --gpus all -it nvcr.io/nvidia/pytorch:24.01-py3
# NGC containers include tested combinations of CUDA, cuDNN, and PyTorch

workarounds.action: Install the matching cuDNN version using conda which handles dependency resolution automatically
workarounds.how:
conda install pytorch torchvision torchaudio pytorch-cuda=12.1 -c pytorch -c nvidia
# conda resolves cuDNN version automatically

leads_to.condition: Partial cuDNN initialization can cause sporadic kernel failures
cuDNN fix attempts that change CUDA version may trigger CUDA/PyTorch version mismatches

preceded_by.condition: Incomplete CUDA toolkit installation often also leaves cuDNN misconfigured
CUDA/PyTorch version mismatch frequently also affects cuDNN compatibility

frequently_confused_with.distinction: CUDNN_STATUS_NOT_INITIALIZED means cuDNN is present but fails to start; 'not compiled with support' means the framework was built without cuDNN entirely
cuBLAS init errors affect linear algebra operations; cuDNN init errors affect convolution and RNN operations. Both are library initialization failures but for different CUDA libraries
